title: Quantum Indeterminacy and Polar Duality: a Probabilistic Approach
abstract:
We present a probabilistic argument supporting the application of polar
duality, as discussed in our previous work, to express the indeterminacy
principle of quantum mechanics. Our approach combines the properties of the
Mahler volume of a convex body with the Donoho--Stark uncertainty principle
from harmonic analysis, which characterizes the concentration of a function and
its Fourier transform. The central result demonstrates that the sum of the
probabilities of position concentration near a convex body and momentum
concentration near its polar dual is equal to one, with an error term that
diminishes rapidly as the number of degrees of freedom increases. This result
motivates the interpretation of polar duality as a kind of geometric Fourier
transform.
